intro: Spergularia platycaulis, commonly known as the flat-stemmed sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed or coastal environments. Spergularia platycaulis is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
